newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: CRICKET-ENGLAND WIN TOSS, ASK NEW ZEALAND TO BAT.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-ENGLAND WIN TOSS, ASK NEW ZEALAND TO BAT.

text.p: England won the toss and asked New Zealand to bat first in the fourth one-day cricket international at Eden Park on Sunday.
The match has been reduced to 43 overs per side after rain delayed the start until 12.10 p.m. (2310 GMT).

England have made one change, with right-arm fast medium bowler Chris Silverwood replacing Dominic Cork. The New Zealand team is unchanged from the one which drew the third one-day match at Napier last Wednesday.
England hold a 2-0 lead in the five-match series after winning the first and second games.
New Zealand must win this match and the final game at Wellington on Tuesday to square the series.
New Zealand: Lee Germon (captain), Bryan Young, Nathan Astle, Adam Parore, Stephen Fleming, Chris Cairns, Chris Harris, Gavin Larsen, Simon Doull, Heath Davis, Geoff Allott.
England: Mike Atherton (captain), Nick Knight, Alec Stewart, Graham Thorpe, Nasser Hussain, Craig White, Ronnie Irani, Chris Silverwood, Robert Croft, Darren Gough, Andrew Caddick.
